Re Dave: ### Scaling Resolutions for the MacBooks External Monitor

---

#### Problem 
Though a 2K monitor can be connected to the macOS successfully as a second display, but the picture quality is not good enough. 

#### Detect Your Display
First, use the following command to find the VendorID and ProcuctID.
```shell
➜  pc_conf git:(main) ✗ ioreg -l | grep "DisplayVendorID"
    | |   | |         "DisplayVendorID" = 4268
➜  pc_conf git:(main) ✗ ioreg -l | grep "DisplayProductID"
    | |   | |         "DisplayProductID" = 41371
```
Then, convert VendorID and ProductID from decimal to hex (4268->10ac & 41371->a19b, dont keep the prefix 0x). 

#### Customize your Resolutions
Open the [link](https://codeclou.github.io/Display-Override-PropertyList-File-Parser-and-Generator-with-HiDPI-Support-For-Scaled-Resolutions/), enter the DisplayProductName/DisplayProductID/DisplayVendorID, and download the generated xml file. 

#### Override System Setting
Firstly, check whether `/Library/Displays/Contents/Resources/Overrides` exists, if not, create it with `sudo mkdir -p /Library/Displays/Contents/Resources/Overrides`. Then, we create a sub-directory, named `DisplayVendorID-xxxx` (e.g., DisplayVendorID-10ac), under the `Overrides`. Finally, copy the generated xml file to `DisplayVendorID-xxxx` and rename it to `DisplayProductID-yyyy` (e.g., DisplayProductID-a19b).

#### Enable HiDPI Mode
```shell
sudo defaults write /Library/Preferences/com.apple.windowserver.plist DisplayResolutionEnabled -bool true
```

#### Restart Mac and use Resolutions
Restart your Mac.

#### Switch Resolution
A very handy tool to enable resolutions is [RDM](https://avi.alkalay.net/software/RDM/).
